messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] WAS "video games/boredom"
messages.msgSnippet: Hi All! We just got Xbox live recently and my darling 11 yo son Cameron would love to play some unschoolers. He noticed the sudden drop-off of possible players
messages.messageBody:
Hi All!

We just got Xbox live recently and my
darling 11 yo son Cameron would love to play some unschoolers. He noticed
the sudden drop-off of possible players this week:-) Ah, school days.
So do you have
any children who would like to share user names on-list or off, in
particular for Halo 2? His username is Abandoned Rose - this is cameron
writing saying "yea i no that is a really sucky name"

Thank you!
Jacki

-----Original Message-----
From: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com]On Behalf Of Ahna
Sent: Thursday, August 11, 2005 8:59 AM
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] WAS "video games/boredom"


Hey,
This kind of late, I'm checking old emails and thought of an option to your
question about
trying out new video games. My son tries out video games at gamefly.com.
It works like
Netflix where you set up a wish list on the internet and they send you video
games which you
can keep as long as you want. When you are tired of the game just send it
back and they
send you another game from your wish list. I find that it saves us a lot of
money because my
son isn't buying lots of games that later turn out to be boring or too easy
for him. Then, if
he really likes a game he can buy it.
Ahna









Yahoo! Groups Links

messages.subject: WAS "video games/boredom"
messages.msgSnippet: Hey, This kind of late, I m checking old emails and thought of an option to your question about trying out new video games.  My son tries out video games at
messages.messageBody:
Hey,
This kind of late, I'm checking old emails and thought of an option to your question about
trying out new video games. My son tries out video games at gamefly.com. It works like
Netflix where you set up a wish list on the internet and they send you video games which you
can keep as long as you want. When you are tired of the game just send it back and they
send you another game from your wish list. I find that it saves us a lot of money because my
son isn't buying lots of games that later turn out to be boring or too easy for him. Then, if
he really likes a game he can buy it.
Ahna
